<p>2025 has brought us the biggest <a data-i13n="cpos:1;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/deals/the-best-amazon-prime-day-deals-for-the-last-day-our-top-picks-on-headphones-tvs-robot-vacuums-and-more-120028336.html">Amazon Prime Day</a> ever and while today is your last chance to partake in the savings, there are still a ton of gaming deals to be had. We're talking about discounts on some of AMD's best gaming CPUs, award-winning titles like <em>Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom</em> and <em>Elden Ring</em> and brand new flagship systems from Alienware, Razer and more. So if you want to get a good price on everything from laptops to displays and all sorts of accessories, keep reading to see our handpicked list of the best gaming deals during Prime Day before they're gone forever (or at least until next year).</p>

But for Prime Day, <em>Echoes of Wisdom </em>is available for 15 percent off, which is even more impressive when you consider the game the game is less than a year old. Not only is this the first Zelda game to put our beloved princess in the spotlight (instead of Link), it offers a fun twist on the series' classic top-down action RPG formula thanks to Zelda's new ability to summon objects and monsters with the Tri-rod.</p>

<p>Alternatively, if you are looking for something a bit faster paced, <em>The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom</em> may be one of the best sequels in recent video game history. And now for Prime Day, it's available for $11 off its normal retail price. Not only is this a great pickup for anyone who hasn't played it yet, it's also a great showcase of the Switch 2's capabilities as users can purchase a $10 upgrade pack (or get it for free if you have a subscription to Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack) that adds support for HDR, faster loading times, enhanced textures and smoother framerates.&nbsp;</p>

<p>At full price, this game was easy to skip. <h2 id="jump-link-best-prime-day-deals-on-vr-headsets">Best Prime Day deals on VR headsets</h2> 
<p><a data-i13n="elm:affiliate_link;sellerN:Amazon;elmt:;cpos:12;pos:1" href="https://shopping.yahoo.com/rdlw?merchantId=66ea567a-c987-4c2e-a2ff-02904efde6ea&amp;itemId=amazon_B0F2GYMC8H&amp;siteId=us-engadget&amp;pageId=1p-autolink&amp;contentUuid=29335a3d-e30a-462a-bc98-ed037a505006&amp;featureId=text-link&amp;merchantName=Amazon&amp;linkText=Meta+Quest+3S+128GB+Bundle+for+%24249+%28%2451+off%29&amp;&amp;signature=AQAAAepE5rK0kewyeLBzsqqXh9JJ5B8M3uFW98PkYPBhQVVg&amp;gcReferrer=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.amazon.com%2FMeta-Quest-128GB-Cardboard-Exclusive-Oculus%2Fdp%2FB0F2GYMC8H" class="rapid-with-clickid" data-original-link="https://www.amazon.com/Meta-Quest-128GB-Cardboard-Exclusive-Oculus/dp/B0F2GYMC8H">Meta Quest 3S 128GB Bundle for $249 ($51 off)</a></p> 
<p>The Quest 3S is one of our picks for <a data-i13n="cpos:13;pos:1" href="https://www.engadget.com/ar-vr/best-vr-headsets-140012529.html">best VR headsets</a> for good reason. Meta cut just the right corners from the more full-featured Quest 3, enabling it to drop the list price down lower. It has the same Snapdragon chip and controlers, but cheaps out a bit on the lenses, slightly lowering the graphics fidelity in use. Just like the Quest 3, it works standalone for lighter games and streaming, or in concert with a gaming PC for full-fat AAA VR titles. It's well worth the $300 Meta usually asks for it, so at $249 with two games included (<em>Cardboard Hero</em> and the excellent social VR hit <em>Gorilla Tag</em>), it's a steal.</p>

The one small downside is that it doesn't have the most impressive peak brightness. But considering everything else this monitor offers, getting one for $1,000 feels like a steal.</p>
